column4: usually the best help comes from people who have experienced the same issue as you and log in and want to help, you dont need to be a "upper echelon" person to be of help.  If you find that no one in the room is able to help you then search in the forums, if it's a bug then search launchpad and/or file a bug report, then try the channel at another time

i've been in the room for 10-15 minutes and you have yet to describe a problem with ubuntu and that you want to fix it ***now***, all  youre saying is you  always have a problem with ubuntu - youre clearly trolling
I've had ubuntu fail several times, freeze. Why does it do that?

how does flash fail when youre using it?  Sound doesnt work or you get no video at all?  I've had the same problem with sound, i see the video but no sound, or the video plays for some time but then it stops
the window shows up, just black where the video is supposed to be but on other videos it works fine
can you give me the url of the video so I can go and see if I am able to see it myself?
this one doesn't work - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aiLveKVQjbY This one works - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dCPQubIE2Hk&feature=rec-LGOUT-real_rn-3r-2-HM
do you have an idea why one would work and the other will not?
it has to do with the flash software, try other drivers
here's your answer, it's a known bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/gtk+2.0/+bug/410407\
the url isn't right.. says - Thereâ€™s no page with this address in Launchpad.
Where do i find flashplugin-nonfree / flashplugin-installer so I can remove it?
I deleted swfdec flash player and installed adobe and now flash works.
awesome! did you follow the bug report in launchpad?  Now if you have anymore issues with ubuntu tackle them one by one and pretty soon your rig will be up and running without a glitch!
